column4: Apple macOS Out-of-Bounds Read Vulnerability
column6: macOS Monterey contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could allow an application to read kernel memory.

column4: Trend Micro Apex Central Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
column6: An arbitrary file upload vulnerability in Trend Micro Apex Central could allow for remote code execution.

column4: Sophos Firewall Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
column6: An authentication bypass vulnerability in User Portal and Webadmin of Sophos Firewall allows for remote code execution.

column4: Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability
column6: Google Chromium V8 Engine contains a type confusion vulnerability that allows a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. This vulnerability could affect multiple web browsers that utilize Chromium	 including	 but not limited to	 Google Chrome	 Microsoft Edge	 and Opera.,"Apply updates per vendor instructions.",2022-04-18,Unknown,https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-1096,CWE-843

column4: Debian-specific Redis Server Lua Sandbox Escape Vulnerability
column6: Redis is prone to a (Debian-specific) Lua sandbox escape	 which could result in remote code execution.

column4: WatchGuard Firebox and XTM Appliances Arbitrary Code Execution
column6: On WatchGuard Firebox and XTM appliances	 an unauthenticated user can execute arbitrary code.

column4: MiCollab	 MiVoice Business Express Access Control Vulnerability
column6: A vulnerability has been identified in MiCollab and MiVoice Business Express that may allow a malicious actor to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information and services	 cause performance degradations or a denial of service condition on the affected system.

column4: Microsoft Windows Print Spooler Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
column6: Microsoft Windows Print Spooler contains an unspecified vulnerability which can allow for privilege escalation.

column4: Mozilla Firefox Use-After-Free Vulnerability
column6: Mozilla Firefox contains a use-after-free vulnerability in WebGPU IPC Framework which can be exploited to perform arbitrary code execution.

column4: Mozilla Firefox Use-After-Free Vulnerability
column6: Mozilla Firefox contains a use-after-free vulnerability in XSLT parameter processing which can be exploited to perform arbitrary code execution.

column3: Small Business RV160	 RV260	 RV340	 and RV345 Series Routers
column4: Cisco Small Business RV Series Routers Stack-based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
column6: A vulnerability in Cisco Small Business RV160	 RV260	 RV340, and RV345 Series Routers could allow an attacker to do any of the following: Execute arbitrary code elevate privileges, execute arbitrary commands, bypass authentication and authorization protections, fetch and run unsigned software, or cause a denial of service (DoS).,"Apply updates per vendor instructions.",2022-03-17,Unknown,https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-20708,CWE-121

column4: Synacor Zimbra Collaborate Suite (ZCS) Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
column6: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) contains a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Calendar feature that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

column4: Zabbix Frontend Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
column6: Unsafe client-side session storage leading to authentication bypass/instance takeover via Zabbix Frontend with configured SAML.

column4: Zabbix Frontend Improper Access Control Vulnerability
column6: Malicious actors can pass step checks and potentially change the configuration of Zabbix Frontend.

column4: Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
column6: Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source contain an improper input validation vulnerability which can allow for arbitrary code execution.

column4: Google Chromium Animation Use-After-Free Vulnerability
column6: Google Chromium Animation contains a use-after-free vulnerability that allows a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. This vulnerability could affect multiple web browsers that utilize Chromium	 including	 but not limited to	 Google Chrome	 Microsoft Edge	 and Opera.,"Apply updates per vendor instructions.",2022-03-01,Unknown,https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-0609,CWE-416

column4: Apple iOS	 iPadOS	 and macOS Webkit Use-After-Free Vulnerability
column6: Apple iOS	 iPadOS, and macOS WebKit contain a use-after-free vulnerability that leads to code execution when processing maliciously crafted web content. This vulnerability could impact HTML parsers that use WebKit, including but not limited to Apple Safari and non-Apple products which rely on WebKit for HTML processing.,"Apply updates per vendor instructions.",2022-02-25,Unknown,https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-22620,CWE-416

column4: Microsoft Win32k Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
column6: Microsoft Win32k contains an unspecified vulnerability that allows for privilege escalation.

column4: Apple Memory Corruption Vulnerability
column6: Apple IOMobileFrameBuffer contains a memory corruption vulnerability which can allow a malicious application to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
